page.title: 03GASCOIGNE WOOD COAL MINE 2
page.content: As well as this they carry a flame safety lamp to detect gas.Each shift produces 16000 tons of coal therefore in one day 48000 tons of coal is extracted from the mine.50 coal trains come every day to collect 1000 tons of coal each.They arrive every half hour, they take a circular route from Gascoigne Wood to Drax Power Station. The coal board bought 164 acres of land from the farmers to build Gascoigne Wood.When the building is finished some land will be returned. They own a lot of machinery such as the Road Heading Machine which cuts the rock.Underground they have three different types of trains some run on diesel, some are battery powered and some are rack and pinion for going up steep slopes.
